text: Estimate the total negative charge in 1g of water. Given that Avogadro number = 6.02 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>23</mn></msup></math> and molecular weight of water = 18.
hint: One molecule of water (<math><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>O) contains 2 + 8 i.e., 10 electrons, Number of molecules in 1 g of water, <math display="block"> <mrow>n=<mfrac><mrow>Avogadro<mtext> </mtext>number</mrow><mrow>atomic<mtext> </mtext>weight</mrow></mfrac>=<mfrac><mrow>6.02×1<msup><mrow>0</mrow><mrow>23</mrow></msup></mrow><mrow>18</mrow></mfrac>=3.344×1<msup><mrow>0</mrow><mrow>22</mrow></msup></mrow> </math> Therefore, number of electrons in 1g of water, n`= n × 10 = 3.344 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>22</mn></msup></math>× 10 = 3.334 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>23</mn></msup></math> The negative charge possessed by 1 g of water, q = n` e = 3.344 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>23</mn></msup></math>× 1.6 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-19</mn></msup></math> = 5.35 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup></math>C
